meanings.definition: Lack of good judgment or discretion.
meanings.sent1: Her injudiciousnesses in spending led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The company suffered due to the injudiciousnesses of its management.
meanings.sent3: Despite her injudiciousnesses in choosing gifts, she always meant well.
meanings.sent4: The injudiciousnesses of his actions left a trail of chaos behind.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of her injudiciousnesses were impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imprudent or unwise.
meanings.sent1: His injudiciousnesses in decision-making cost the team the game.
meanings.sent2: The injudiciousnesses of his remarks offended many people.
meanings.sent3: Despite his injudiciousnesses, he managed to learn from his mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The injudiciousnesses of his choices haunted him for years.
meanings.sent5: The weight of his injudiciousnesses bore down heavily on his conscience.
